title: Self-Awareness Together
description: Explore how being with your partner helps you understand yourself better.

questions.text: Being with you has helped me see...
choices: My patterns and tendencies more clearly
My strengths I didn't fully appreciate
Areas where I want to grow
Who I am when I feel safe and loved

therapeutic.rationale: Partners serve as mirrors reflecting ourselves. Pattern-seers gain self-knowledge; strength-seers gain confidence; growth-seers gain direction; safe-self seers gain security. Relationships that enhance self-awareness are deeply connecting.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different insights from being together are all valuable. Your partner helps you see different parts of yourself.
therapeutic.whenSame: Matched insights show you're both gaining similar self-awareness from your relationship.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What has being with your partner helped you see about yourself?

questions.text: When you gently point out something about me, I...
choices: Appreciate the insight and try to learn
Need time to process before responding
Sometimes feel defensive at first
Am grateful you know me well enough to see it

therapeutic.rationale: Receiving partner feedback reveals openness and security. Learners embrace growth; processors need time; defensive types may feel vulnerable; grateful types feel seen. Understanding your pattern helps you improve reception.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different reception patterns are normal. The processor and the learner may need different approaches to feedback conversations.
therapeutic.whenSame: Matched reception creates smoother feedback exchanges.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: How do you receive it when your partner points out something about you? Could you receive it better?

questions.text: Something I've learned about myself through us is...
choices: How I show love and what I need
How I handle stress and conflict
What triggers me and where that comes from
What I value most in a partner

therapeutic.rationale: Relationship learning reveals self-knowledge gained through partnership. Love-language learners understand expression; stress-handlers understand reactions; trigger-understanders know their history; value-clarifiers know their needs. All are valuable insights.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different learnings are all valuable. You've each gained different self-knowledge from your relationship.
therapeutic.whenSame: Matched learnings show you've grown in similar areas through your relationship.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What have you learned about yourself through being in this relationship?

questions.text: I want you to help me grow by...
choices: Believing in me and encouraging me
Being honest about what you see
Being patient with my process
Growing alongside me as partners

therapeutic.rationale: Growth invitations reveal what support we need. Belief-seekers need faith; honesty-seekers need truth; patience-seekers need time; co-growers need partnership. Explicitly inviting support helps partners provide it.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different growth invitations require learning what your partner needs. What helps you may not help them.
therapeutic.whenSame: Matched growth invitations create natural support dynamics.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What kind of support helps you grow? Have you explicitly invited your partner to provide it?

questions.text: I believe being in a relationship should...
choices: Help us become better versions of ourselves
Reveal parts of us we couldn't see alone
Challenge us to grow while feeling supported
Make us more self-aware and self-accepting

therapeutic.rationale: Beliefs about relationship growth shape expectations. Better-selves believers see improvement; revealer believers see discovery; challenge-seekers see supported growth; awareness believers see understanding. All are healthy views of relationship as growth opportunity.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: All these benefits are real. Relationships can provide all forms of growth.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared philosophy about relationship growth creates aligned expectations for how you'll develop together.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: How do you believe being in a relationship should help you grow?
